programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
Gwiazdorskie życie
Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc:
Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping: Directed by Akiva Schaffer, Jorma Taccone. With Andy Samberg, Jorma Taccone, Akiva Schaffer, Sarah Silverman. When it becomes clear that his solo album is a failure, a former boy band member does everything in his power to maintain his celebrity status." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3960412/","name":"Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMxMzk2ODI4N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzgzNzQ5ODE@._V1_.jpg","description":"When it becomes clear that his solo album is a failure, a former boy band member does everything in his power to maintain his celebrity status.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3960412/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tjgoalie13"},"dateCreated":"2016-06-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Little Formulaic, But Admittedly Funny.","reviewBody":"Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping never looked all that appealing to me, but I must say it was surprisingly better than I expected. Seeing the trailers I thought the film was another in a wave of ultra dumb comedies, but up front, it's really not. Popstar is a little formulaic, but is admittedly funny, and finds a way to even be witty. Even more impressive, although not all that surprising is that some of the songs in this movie are actually pretty catchy, albeit mock-ups.

For those who love This is Spinal Tap and other films of that nature, this film is a little derivative. That being said, it's not as if this is just a rehash of other better films, that entire genre does require modernizations every few years. Because this film is spoofing not only the musicians of today, but everybody in the entertainment world. That being said this film does list as another Judd Apatow film and does have some formulaic moments that appear in all of his films.

The most notable "Appatowism" in this film is the overdone comedy trope of today, where the film lingers on jokes far longer than they should, under the illusion that lingering over a joke makes it funnier. It's kinda like when a goofy kid makes a great joke everybody laughs, and then the kid gets confident and keeps pushing the joke until everybody around is just wishing he'd shut up and go away. That being said, the film doesn't live off the annoying lingering joke, and succeeds at being genuinely funny, all the time. It's not the funniest movie this year, and it may not even be hilarious, but the film is consistently littered with raunchy funny jokes, that often deliver.

The film was marketed poorly, in my opinion, because it came across as an ultra dumb comedy, and in reality isn't half as dumb as it comes across as. The film occasionally wanders into the dumb comedy area, but often finds it's way back into the land of witty comedies, making it somewhat of a mixed bag. For instance, the songs are catchy, they are witty reflections of our pop stars, but they are also a little too on the nose, making them come across as a little dumb. That being said, underneath the thin exterior of a dumb comedy is a really witty reflection of our current music industry, and the pressures, idiocracy, immaturity, selfishness, and chaos commonly associated with it.

Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping is filled with cameos from famous musicians and comedy actors, some of which even lend their singing talents to the musical pieces. At times it feels like the entire music industry is in this film, as they play along on a mockumentary making fun of them. However, the film is never really mean spirited, or all that damning it just grooves along, spoofing everybody from the musicians to the fans. For those who like the lonely island, you'll love this movie, and for those who are seeking a funny comedy, regardless of rating this is also a movie you'll love, but there should be a note, this movie really isn't for kids or the weak spined.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":58976,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Musical"],"datePublished":"2016-06-03","keywords":"pop star,scene during end credits,repetition in title,concert,mockumentary","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2277946393","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTAxMzA4MTIzNzReQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDU1Mzc0OTgx._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTAxMzA4MTIzNzReQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDU1Mzc0OTgx._V1_.jpg","description":"When his new album fails to sell records, pop/rap superstar conner4real goes into a major tailspin and watches his celebrity high life begin to collapse. He'll try anything to bounce back, anything except reuniting with his old rap group The Style Boyz."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1676221/","name":"Andy Samberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1672246/","name":"Jorma Taccone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1676223/","name":"Akiva Schaffer"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1676223/","name":"Akiva Schaffer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1672246/","name":"Jorma Taccone"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0346224/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0073081/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1676221/","name":"Andy Samberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1676223/","name":"Akiva Schaffer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1672246/","name":"Jorma Taccone"}],"duration":"PT1H27M"}</script><metacontent="

When it becomes clear that his solo album is a failure, a former boy band member does everything in his power to maintain his celebrity status." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3960412/","name":"Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMxMzk2ODI4N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzgzNzQ5ODE@._V1_.jpg","description":"When it becomes clear that his solo album is a failure, a former boy band member does everything in his power to maintain his celebrity status.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3960412/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"tjgoalie13","dateCreated":"2016-06-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Little Formulaic, But Admittedly Funny.","reviewBody":"Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping never looked all that appealing to me, but I must say it was surprisingly better than I expected. Seeing the trailers I thought the film was another in a wave of ultra dumb comedies, but up front, it's really not. Popstar is a little formulaic, but is admittedly funny, and finds a way to even be witty. Even more impressive, although not all that surprising is that some of the songs in this movie are actually pretty catchy, albeit mock-ups.

For those who love This is Spinal Tap and other films of that nature, this film is a little derivative. That being said, it's not as if this is just a rehash of other better films, that entire genre does require modernizations every few years. Because this film is spoofing not only the musicians of today, but everybody in the entertainment world. That being said this film does list as another Judd Apatow film and does have some formulaic moments that appear in all of his films.

The most notable "Appatowism" in this film is the overdone comedy trope of today, where the film lingers on jokes far longer than they should, under the illusion that lingering over a joke makes it funnier. It's kinda like when a goofy kid makes a great joke everybody laughs, and then the kid gets confident and keeps pushing the joke until everybody around is just wishing he'd shut up and go away. That being said, the film doesn't live off the annoying lingering joke, and succeeds at being genuinely funny, all the time. It's not the funniest movie this year, and it may not even be hilarious, but the film is consistently littered with raunchy funny jokes, that often deliver.

The film was marketed poorly, in my opinion, because it came across as an ultra dumb comedy, and in reality isn't half as dumb as it comes across as. The film occasionally wanders into the dumb comedy area, but often finds it's way back into the land of witty comedies, making it somewhat of a mixed bag. For instance, the songs are catchy, they are witty reflections of our pop stars, but they are also a little too on the nose, making them come across as a little dumb. That being said, underneath the thin exterior of a dumb comedy is a really witty reflection of our current music industry, and the pressures, idiocracy, immaturity, selfishness, and chaos commonly associated with it.

Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping is filled with cameos from famous musicians and comedy actors, some of which even lend their singing talents to the musical pieces. At times it feels like the entire music industry is in this film, as they play along on a mockumentary making fun of them. However, the film is never really mean spirited, or all that damning it just grooves along, spoofing everybody from the musicians to the fans. For those who like the lonely island, you'll love this movie, and for those who are seeking a funny comedy, regardless of rating this is also a movie you'll love, but there should be a note, this movie really isn't for kids or the weak spined.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":58976,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Musical"],"datePublished":"2016-06-03","keywords":"pop star,scene during end credits,repetition in title,concert,mockumentary","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2277946393","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTAxMzA4MTIzNzReQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDU1Mzc0OTgx._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTAxMzA4MTIzNzReQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDU1Mzc0OTgx._V1_.jpg","description":"When his new album fails to sell records, pop/rap superstar conner4real goes into a major tailspin and watches his celebrity high life begin to collapse. This movie was the best movie I have ever seen. I am a huge Christopher Nolan fan and this movie was his finest. Matthew McConaughey turned in his best performance of his lifetime. Anne Hathaway was an amazing supporting actress and compared to her performance in Les Miserables, I have no idea how she didn't get an Oscar for this. The visual effects were more than just Oscar worthy. They were pioneering. I have never seen anything like it. One thing I would recommend is having a little previous knowledge about space. Not like Einstein stuff though. I would recommend you see this movie as fast as you can if you are a Nolan fan or not. programme.desc: John Oliver, jedna z najbarwniejszych postaci amerykańskiej telewizji, zaprasza na ósmy sezon show, w którym prezentuje swój punkt widzenia i komentuje wydarzenia minionego tygodnia. Porusza polityczne kwestie, które angażują uwagę wszystkich mieszkańców USA, stosuje cięte riposty i z angielskim dystansem rozbawia widzów.

programme.title: Chocolat
Czekolada
Chocolat
programme.desc:
Chocolat: Directed by Lasse Hallström. With Alfred Molina, Carrie-Anne Moss, Aurelien Parent Koenig, Antonio Gil. A French woman and her young daughter open up a chocolate shop in a small remote village that shakes up the rigid morality of the community." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0241303/","name":"Chocolat","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWYwMjMxZWQtMzQ3OS00YWNhLThkNDItYTk4NDdhZDE4ZTEzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODU5MDg5OTY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A French woman and her young daughter open up a chocolate shop in a small remote village that shakes up the rigid morality of the community.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0241303/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"FigNewton"},"dateCreated":"2001-08-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Mmmm, Mmmm, Good!","reviewBody":"I had heard all the rave reviews, saw the number of Oscar nominations this flick received but still wasn't convinced it was a movie I'd like. I want to kick myself now for waiting this long to see it! Yes, I forsook the big screen for the video but I wasn't disappointed a bit.

Chocolat is a wonderful movie. It deals with real issues that people face. The characters are believable because they have flaws. They've got inward struggles which makes this film even better. It's a story of the human condition and how even deep prejudices can be overcome by the simple act of kindness and the willingness to strive for individuality.

I have to admit the only reason I wanted to watch this movie at first was because of Johnny Depp. I have to say I loved his performance as Roux. I wished the writers would've done more with his character but what we did get to feast on was incredible. Juliette Binoche was also incredible as Vianne and the chemistry between all the actors was great.

I would recommend Chocolat. If you haven't seen it, what are you waiting for? It's great to see there are still film makers out there that have a sense of humanity. Chocolat is all of that and more.

 Chocolat was indeed Mmmm, Mmmm, good!!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":185912,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2001-10-24","keywords":"chocolate,france,village,food,magical realism","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Chocolat","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2733547033","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDRjNGI4MmYtY2U1ZS00N2UzLTk5MzgtMjIxYjlhMDI2NWVhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDRjNGI4MmYtY2U1ZS00N2UzLTk5MzgtMjIxYjlhMDI2NWVhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000300/","name":"Juliette Binoche"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001132/","name":"Judi Dench"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000547/","name":"Alfred Molina"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002120/","name":"Lasse Hallström"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022594/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0031919/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0104130/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0364862/","name":"Joanne Harris"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0414608/","name":"Robert Nelson Jacobs"}],"duration":"PT2H1M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: You Can't Fight Christmas
You Can't Fight Christmas
programme.desc: You Can't Fight Christmas: Directed by Kenny Young. With Brely Evans, Andra Fuller, Persia White, Porscha Coleman. An unlikely encounter between Christmas designer and enthusiast Leslie Major, and a businessman trying to end the Christmas tradition at The Chesterton makes Leslie use all her Christmas charms on him to love Christmas. - and her." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7281472/","name":"You Can't Fight Christmas","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkzNTY1MDUzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTQ0MTEzNDM@._V1_.jpg","description":"An unlikely encounter between Christmas designer and enthusiast Leslie Major, and a businessman trying to end the Christmas tradition at The Chesterton makes Leslie use all her Christmas charms on him to love Christmas. - and her.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7281472/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sotheguy"},"dateCreated":"2017-12-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good sunday afternoon watch","reviewBody":"This is a "sister" movie to Miss Me This Christmas ...and in my humble opinion, better. So I would advise watching that one first, then give it at least a day, then check this one. It's light hearted and they've tried to stay away from the usual stereotypes of black movies. Remember it's still a light lovable tv movie. Overall it's a good watch and the characters are generally believable and even likeable.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":809,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.7},"genre":["Comedy","Family","Romance"],"datePublished":"2017-12-10","keywords":"love,christmas","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3858768/","name":"Brely Evans"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1822183/","name":"Andra Fuller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0925316/","name":"Persia White"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0949774/","name":"Kenny Young"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0410661/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9218837/","name":"Marnie Martin"}],"duration":"PT1H27M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Odnaleźć miłość
programme.desc: Ambitna menadżerka Amber Verdon (Brittany Bristow) otrzymuje ofertę pracy w Londynie, o której zawsze marzyła. Niespodziewanie musi jednak wrócić do miejsca, gdzie dorastała, żeby pomóc rodzicom. Tam poznaje idealnego mężczyznę. Jednocześnie odżywa w niej dawno stłumiona pasja - malarstwo.

programme.title: Christmas in Washington
Święta w Waszyngtonie
Christmas in Washington
programme.desc:
Christmas in Washington: Directed by Adrian Langley. With Natalie Lisinska, Damon Runyan, Kathleen Laskey, James Kall. Decorator Emily Barnes gets the gig of a lifetime decorating the Belmarian Embassy for the festive season. New ambassador Magnus Anderson has no time for the holidays. Emily shows Magnus how magical Christmas can be and sparks soon fly." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt14502376/","name":"Christmas in Washington","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjViODZjYTItNjRmMi00YjA4LTg4MmYtY2M2MDk4ZmFhYzhkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQyNDk2NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Decorator Emily Barnes gets the gig of a lifetime decorating the Belmarian Embassy for the festive season. New ambassador Magnus Anderson has no time for the holidays. Emily shows Magnus how magical Christmas can be and sparks soon f","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt14502376/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Jackbv123"},"dateCreated":"2021-12-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Overplayed","reviewBody":"For those who like some tension in their Christmas movies, there is a villain. Unfortunately, he was a little too crude for the circumstances. Big Dan looked a little too much like a stereotypical mob boss and acted like one too.

It was also hard to buy into the Ambassador's rigidity at the beginning and it melted away pretty fast. The assistant, Arvid, was likewise a little too much.

The daughter brought the usual bump in the story. programme.title: Smak Bożego Narodzenia
programme.desc: Szefowa kuchni i współwłaścicielka restauracji, Scarlett (Britt Irvin), otrzymuje od przyjaciela niezwykły prezent. Zostaje przez niego wysłana na kurs gotowania. When a movie starts off with fast, stupid, never ending back and forth, it's a loser. I think it's scrip writers who are inexperienced and think it's cool to fill up every second with meaningless drivel (but it has to be loaded with words. Hopefully, experience will stop this nonsense, and talent will take over. I'm an optimist.\n\nBottom Line: I made it about 10 minutes before I hit the "Kill This Junk" button. Don't waste your time. Try underwater basket weaving as a step up.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":167,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1},"genre":["Romance"],"datePublished":"2021-12-06","keywords":"christmas","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Falling in Love at Christmas - International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1950531609","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2UxNTViYjAtY2M1OS00ODdlLTgwMGUtNGZlNzY0Y2EwMDM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2UxNTViYjAtY2M1OS00ODdlLTgwMGUtNGZlNzY0Y2EwMDM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3880577/","name":"Alicia Dea Josipovic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3303404/","name":"Travis Nelson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7533719/","name":"Getenesh Berhe"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0507746/","name":"Sharon Lewis"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0787651/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0782546/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3269314/","name":"John Dion"}],"duration":"PT1H25M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Daddy's Home
Tata kontra tata
Daddy's Home
programme.desc:
Daddy's Home: Directed by Sean Anders. With Will Ferrell, Mark Wahlberg, Linda Cardellini, Thomas Haden Church. Brad Whitaker is a radio host trying to get his stepchildren to love him and call him Dad. But his plans turn upside down when their biological father, Dusty Mayron, returns." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1528854/","name":"Daddy's Home","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ0OTE1MTk4N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDM5OTk5NjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Brad Whitaker is a radio host trying to get his stepchildren to love him and call him Dad. But his plans turn upside down when their biological father, Dusty Mayron, returns.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1528854/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jtindahouse"},"dateCreated":"2015-12-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Has its moments but it's no game-changer","reviewBody":"'Daddy's Home' is the second collaboration between Will Ferrell and Mark Wahlberg, the first being 2010's 'The Other Guys'. There's no doubt the two have chemistry. What there is doubt about is how to perfectly utilise each of the two as characters. The problem is that for Wahlberg's confident, in-charge character (which he has to play) to work Ferrell needs to play the straight guy and that isn't when he's at his best. He does it well there's no doubt about it, but he's at his best when his character has an edge to him like 'Ron Burgundy' or his character in 'Step Brothers'. Playing the overly straight guy just seems almost a waste for the one Ferrell movie we get a year, even though no one could deny he still does it very well. 

The difference in quality between this and 'Get Hard' is noticeable. There, Kevin Hart was unable to find a chemistry with Ferrell and it just turned into the two competing with each other trying to make the movie their own. Here that's not the case. Wahlberg seems happy to let Ferrell take the reins and is comfortable just doing what he does best, with his laid back, dry sense of humour accompanying Ferrell perfectly. 

There are consistent laughs throughout, but perhaps not one stand out scene that will be memorable for years to come. It doesn't push the envelope as much as other Ferrell movies have in the past either. I really would love to see him always be given free rein to say and do as he pleases but also understand why that can't always be the case. If you're just looking to get your annual fix of a bit of Ferrell hilarity then you won't be disappointed. If you are looking for a game-changer, perhaps wait for the next one.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":115615,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2015-12-30","keywords":"sweat,pull,pull ups,push,muscle","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1706799641","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzM0NjMzMzAzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTQwMjExNzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzM0NjMzMzAzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTQwMjExNzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A mild-mannered radio executive strives to become the best stepdad to his wife's two children, but complications ensue when their freewheeling and freeloading real father arrives, forcing him to compete for the affection of the kids."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002071/","name":"Will Ferrell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000242/","name":"Mark Wahlberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004802/","name":"Linda Cardellini"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1890845/","name":"Sean Anders"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0325207/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0186190/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0122602/","name":"Brian Burns"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1890845/","name":"Sean Anders"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1898234/","name":"John Morris"}],"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Stardust
Gwiezdny pył
Stardust
programme.desc: Stardust: Directed by Matthew Vaughn. With Ian McKellen, Bimbo Hart, Alastair MacIntosh, David Kelly. In a countryside town bordering on a magical land, a young man makes a promise to his beloved that he'll retrieve a fallen star by venturing into the magical realm." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0486655/","name":"Stardust","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjkyMTE1OTYwNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDIxODYzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In a countryside town bordering on a magical land, a young man makes a promise to his beloved that he'll retrieve a fallen star by venturing into the magical realm.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0486655/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dave_wright87"},"dateCreated":"2007-11-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"The most fantastical adventure of the year!","reviewBody":"I went into this film with modest hopes, the director had pedigree, I had seen Charlie Cox in Casanova and was impressed, and literally EVERYONE had been raving about it. As the story started to unfold I was introduced to Victorian England on one side of a mysterious Wall, and on the other a magical land, Stormhold. The actual plot weaves together many strands and I don't want to ruin the surprises for anyone, but at the barest it is the simple tale of a young man (Charlie Cox) in love with the village beauty (Sienna Miller). To win her love he tells her he will fetch back a fallen star from the other side of the Wall. Howver when he arrives at the star he finds not a lump of astral metal as he expected but a beautiful woman (Claire Danes). As the two journey back to the wall they find themselves in the adventure of a lifetime. The visuals are brilliant, England looks stunning, in a similar fashion to New Zealand in LOTR, and it s full of wonderful little flourishes, such as the way that the star shines when she is happy, a very simple effect, but one that looks radiant. As well as this the acting good, especially from the leads and Robert DeNiro, whose turn as the captain of an airship is incredibly memorable. This film is THE perfect date movie, it is romantic without being a "chick flick", funny and full of wonderful action pieces that will satisfy any action film fan. IMDb data; ttnr: 0486655, Title: Stardust, --- Description: Stardust: Directed by Matthew Vaughn. With Ian McKellen, Bimbo Hart, Alastair MacIntosh, David Kelly. In a countryside town bordering on a magical land, a young man makes a promise to his beloved that he'll retrieve a fallen star by venturing into the magical realm." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0486655/","name":"Stardust","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjkyMTE1OTYwNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDIxODYzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In a countryside town bordering on a magical land, a young man makes a promise to his beloved that he'll retrieve a fallen star by venturing into the magical realm.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0486655/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"dave_wright87","dateCreated":"2007-11-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"The most fantastical adventure of the year!","reviewBody":"I went into this film with modest hopes, the director had pedigree, I had seen Charlie Cox in Casanova and was impressed, and literally EVERYONE had been raving about it. As the story started to unfold I was introduced to Victorian England on one side of a mysterious Wall, and on the other a magical land, Stormhold. The actual plot weaves together many strands and I don't want to ruin the surprises for anyone, but at the barest it is the simple tale of a young man (Charlie Cox) in love with the village beauty (Sienna Miller). To win her love he tells her he will fetch back a fallen star from the other side of the Wall. Howver when he arrives at the star he finds not a lump of astral metal as he expected but a beautiful woman (Claire Danes). As the two journey back to the wall they find themselves in the adventure of a lifetime. The visuals are brilliant, England looks stunning, in a similar fashion to New Zealand in LOTR, and it s full of wonderful little flourishes, such as the way that the star shines when she is happy, a very simple effect, but one that looks radiant. As well as this the acting good, especially from the leads and Robert DeNiro, whose turn as the captain of an airship is incredibly memorable. This film is THE perfect date movie, it is romantic without being a "chick flick", funny and full of wonderful action pieces that will satisfy any action film fan. All in all it is a truly magical experience from beginning to end, and I now Im raving about it to EVERYONE!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":265282,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Family","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2007-10-24","keywords":"witch,magic,transformation,shooting star,one word title","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Stardust","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4018471193","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjM0NDhmOGMtNjk3MS00ZjFkLThhOGQtZmZiYmY5OWI2MDM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjM0NDhmOGMtNjk3MS00ZjFkLThhOGQtZmZiYmY5OWI2MDM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Paramount","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1214435/","name":"Charlie Cox","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000132/","name":"Claire Danes","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1092227/","name":"Sienna Miller"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0891216/","name":"Matthew Vaughn"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0165404/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0325567/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0963359/","name":"Jane Goldman","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0891216/","name":"Matthew Vaughn","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0301274/","name":"Neil Gaiman"],"duration":"PT2H7M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 2
Kill Bill 2
Kill Bill: Vol. 2
programme.desc:
Kill Bill: Vol. 2: Directed by Quentin Tarantino. With Vivica A. Fox, Ambrosia Kelley, Michael Parks, James Parks. The Bride continues her quest of vengeance against her former boss and lover Bill, the reclusive bouncer Budd, and the treacherous, one-eyed Elle." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0378194/","name":"Kill Bill: Vol. 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmFiYmJmN2QtNWQwMi00MzliLThiOWMtZjQxNGRhZTQ1MjgyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzQ1ODk3MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Bride continues her quest of vengeance against her former boss and lover Bill, the reclusive bouncer Budd, and the treacherous, one-eyed Elle.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0378194/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"PlutonicLove"},"dateCreated":"2004-04-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"It transcends its genre and becomes Tarantino's most thoughtful and sophisticated work","reviewBody":"In my brief, initial review of 'Kill Bill Vol. 1.' I made the regrettable mistake of dismissing it as exceedingly pleasing yet unsubstantial stylistic masturbation, lacking the profundity and characterizations of Tarantino's previous works. Rarely have I been happier to be proven wrong.

What once seemed like somewhat incoherent cinematic recklessness has, after viewing the second part of Mr. Tarantino's saga, revealed itself to be wild, imaginative and brilliant filmmaking. As a whole, 'Kill Bill' is utterly unified (not despite but because of the radical shift in tone), possesses a strong, dramatic ark, and, above all, stands as quite possibly the most passionate, loving tribute to cinema I have ever seen. While part one pays homage to Brian De Palma, Dario Argento and the Shaw Brothers, part two cites, among many others, Jean-Luc Godard, Sergio Leone, and Robert Siodmark.

But that's far from all.

In his critical essay 'The Cinema of the Cool', Kevin Murphy suggests that Tarantino must move on and grow up to fully realize his potential as a filmmaker. In my opinion, with this piece, he has done so. Those merely seeking the blood-splattered, broken-bone action of Vol. 1 will be severely disappointed by Vol. 2, which is infinitely more thoughtful, pondering the nature of violence, both in cause and effect. While the action in the first installment was great, comic book fun, here it becomes severely unpleasant, cringe inducing, and never without consequence. If anything, it reminded me of the great Akira Kurosawa's work. Remarkable."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":722043,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2004-12-08","keywords":"bride,vengeance,revenge,female assassin,martial arts","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Kill Bill: Vol. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi405667865","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjA3OThlOWUtZWZiYi00M2I2LTg0Y2QtNWY2YThjZjE4Y2U1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjA3OThlOWUtZWZiYi00M2I2LTg0Y2QtNWY2YThjZjE4Y2U1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"CT #1, post"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000235/","name":"Uma Thurman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001016/","name":"David Carradine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000514/","name":"Michael Madsen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000233/","name":"Quentin Tarantino"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022594/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019267/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0086625/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000233/","name":"Quentin Tarantino"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000235/","name":"Uma Thurman"}],"duration":"PT2H17M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Homemade Christmas
Święta na zamówienie
Homemade Christmas
programme.desc:
Homemade Christmas: Directed by Adrian Langley. With Michelle Argyris, Travis Nelson, Marcello Di Fruscia, Brianna Barnes. Megan uses the weeks leading up to every Christmas to help around with any Christmas-related tasks. When the opportunity arrives to save a Christmas party and dazzle her crush, she must choose between the man of her dreams and Mr. Right." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt13189624/","name":"Homemade Christmas","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDdhNWZjNjctZWNlMS00MmY3LTk4NzQtNGRmOGFkNzVmNTVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQyNDk2NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Megan uses the weeks leading up to every Christmas to help around with any Christmas-related tasks. When the opportunity arrives to save a Christmas party and dazzle her crush, she must choose between the man of her dreams and Mr. Ri","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt13189624/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Jackbv123"},"dateCreated":"2020-11-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good chemistry","reviewBody":"The premise boils down to consultant-comes-in-to-save-the-business but there's a different flavor to it. For one thing, there's also a Christmas-coach slant to it. And the consultant to save the business isn't really a business consultant, but a Jacqueline of all trades who majors in DIY. The movie didn't cram in all of the usual Christmas devices, but the snowball exchange was a little obvious. There are no big surprises.

Michelle Argyris has chemistry with both of the male leads, but after a bit, Chase turns into the business-focus exec who doesn't really care about people. He's also controlling and not too respectful of women.

Meanwhile Kurt, played by Travis Nelson has obvious connection with Argyris even when they are sparring with each other and it only goes up from there. This is the enjoyable part of the movie watching these two get closer then back away and then repeat.

Megan seems a little too good to be true at least as far as selflessness. She has some insecurities that come out over time, but a really tough façade.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":488,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2020-11-22","keywords":"personal assistant,toy store owner,interior designer,mistaken identity,blog","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Homemade Christmas - International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi225755417","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTc4MmZlNTYtMjI4Mi00MDIxLWI3OTEtMjBiMzE3ZjdmYjc5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTc4MmZlNTYtMjI4Mi00MDIxLWI3OTEtMjBiMzE3ZjdmYjc5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4679011/","name":"Michelle Argyris"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3303404/","name":"Travis Nelson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7077067/","name":"Marcello Di Fruscia"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1454995/","name":"Adrian Langley"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0822895/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3269314/","name":"John Dion"}],"duration":"PT1H25M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Olivia jest nauczycielką baletu. Na jej zajęcia chodzi bardzo utalentowana Lily, którą wychowuje samotnie ojciec, Michael. Gdy uczennica razem z tatą stają się gwiazdami viralowego filmiku tanecznego, mężczyzna zyskuje sławę, a także sympatię mistrzyni tańca.

Homemade Christmas: Directed by Adrian Langley. With Michelle Argyris, Travis Nelson, Marcello Di Fruscia, Brianna Barnes. Megan uses the weeks leading up to every Christmas to help around with any Christmas-related tasks. When the opportunity arrives to save a Christmas party and dazzle her crush, she must choose between the man of her dreams and Mr. Right." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt13189624/","name":"Homemade Christmas","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDdhNWZjNjctZWNlMS00MmY3LTk4NzQtNGRmOGFkNzVmNTVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQyNDk2NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Megan uses the weeks leading up to every Christmas to help around with any Christmas-related tasks. When the opportunity arrives to save a Christmas party and dazzle her crush, she must choose between the man of her dreams and Mr. Ri","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt13189624/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Jackbv123"},"dateCreated":"2020-11-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good chemistry","reviewBody":"The premise boils down to consultant-comes-in-to-save-the-business but there's a different flavor to it. For one thing, there's also a Christmas-coach slant to it. And the consultant to save the business isn't really a business consultant, but a Jacqueline of all trades who majors in DIY. The movie didn't cram in all of the usual Christmas devices, but the snowball exchange was a little obvious. There are no big surprises.

Michelle Argyris has chemistry with both of the male leads, but after a bit, Chase turns into the business-focus exec who doesn't really care about people. He's also controlling and not too respectful of women.

Meanwhile Kurt, played by Travis Nelson has obvious connection with Argyris even when they are sparring with each other and it only goes up from there. This is the enjoyable part of the movie watching these two get closer then back away and then repeat.

Megan seems a little too good to be true at least as far as selflessness. She has some insecurities that come out over time, but a really tough façade.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":488,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2020-11-22","keywords":"personal assistant,toy store owner,interior designer,mistaken identity,blog","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Homemade Christmas - International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi225755417","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTc4MmZlNTYtMjI4Mi00MDIxLWI3OTEtMjBiMzE3ZjdmYjc5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTc4MmZlNTYtMjI4Mi00MDIxLWI3OTEtMjBiMzE3ZjdmYjc5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4679011/","name":"Michelle Argyris"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3303404/","name":"Travis Nelson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7077067/","name":"Marcello Di Fruscia"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1454995/","name":"Adrian Langley"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0822895/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3269314/","name":"John Dion"}],"duration":"PT1H25M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Stardust
Gwiezdny pył
Stardust
programme.desc: Stardust: Directed by Matthew Vaughn. With Ian McKellen, Bimbo Hart, Alastair MacIntosh, David Kelly. In a countryside town bordering on a magical land, a young man makes a promise to his beloved that he'll retrieve a fallen star by venturing into the magical realm." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0486655/","name":"Stardust","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjkyMTE1OTYwNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDIxODYzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In a countryside town bordering on a magical land, a young man makes a promise to his beloved that he'll retrieve a fallen star by venturing into the magical realm.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0486655/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dave_wright87"},"dateCreated":"2007-11-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"The most fantastical adventure of the year!","reviewBody":"I went into this film with modest hopes, the director had pedigree, I had seen Charlie Cox in Casanova and was impressed, and literally EVERYONE had been raving about it. As the story started to unfold I was introduced to Victorian England on one side of a mysterious Wall, and on the other a magical land, Stormhold. The actual plot weaves together many strands and I don't want to ruin the surprises for anyone, but at the barest it is the simple tale of a young man (Charlie Cox) in love with the village beauty (Sienna Miller). To win her love he tells her he will fetch back a fallen star from the other side of the Wall. Howver when he arrives at the star he finds not a lump of astral metal as he expected but a beautiful woman (Claire Danes). As the two journey back to the wall they find themselves in the adventure of a lifetime. The visuals are brilliant, England looks stunning, in a similar fashion to New Zealand in LOTR, and it s full of wonderful little flourishes, such as the way that the star shines when she is happy, a very simple effect, but one that looks radiant. As well as this the acting good, especially from the leads and Robert DeNiro, whose turn as the captain of an airship is incredibly memorable. This film is THE perfect date movie, it is romantic without being a "chick flick", funny and full of wonderful action pieces that will satisfy any action film fan. All in all it is a truly magical experience from beginning to end, and I now Im raving about it to EVERYONE!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":265282,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Family","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2007-10-24","keywords":"witch,magic,transformation,shooting star,one word title","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Stardust","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4018471193","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjM0NDhmOGMtNjk3MS00ZjFkLThhOGQtZmZiYmY5OWI2MDM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjM0NDhmOGMtNjk3MS00ZjFkLThhOGQtZmZiYmY5OWI2MDM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Paramount"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1214435/","name":"Charlie Cox"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000132/","name":"Claire Danes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1092227/","name":"Sienna Miller"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0891216/","name":"Matthew Vaughn"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0165404/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0325567/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0963359/","name":"Jane Goldman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0891216/","name":"Matthew Vaughn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0301274/","name":"Neil Gaiman"}],"duration":"PT2H7M"}</script><metacontent="

Bad Santa
programme.desc:
Bad Santa: Directed by Terry Zwigoff. With Billy Bob Thornton, Tony Cox, Brett Kelly, Lauren Graham. A miserable conman and his partner pose as Santa and his Little Helper to rob department stores on Christmas Eve. But they run into problems when the conman befriends a troubled kid." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0307987/","name":"Bad Santa","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA4Njg1MDcwN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMzAxNjM3._V1_.jpg","description":"A miserable conman and his partner pose as Santa and his Little Helper to rob department stores on Christmas Eve. But they run into problems when the conman befriends a troubled kid.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0307987/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dpolwatte"},"dateCreated":"2018-12-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Bad Santa (2003)","reviewBody":"An extreme end to christmas comedy genre. It's so vulgar it makes you puke. It's so dark and makes you laugh to things you never wants to laugh but you'll still laugh anyway.

It's innovative cinematic style that embeds Tarantino, Ritchie and many darkly comic film makers makes this a unique gem of a film.

Characters are amazing. Style and film making is exceptional. Still it's a cinematic experience. And a fresh one at that.

programme.title: Assassin's Creed
Assassin's Creed
programme.desc:
Assassin's Creed: Directed by Justin Kurzel. With Michael Fassbender, Marion Cotillard, Jeremy Irons, Brendan Gleeson. Callum Lynch explores the memories of his ancestor Aguilar de Nerha and gains the skills of a Master Assassin, before taking on the secret Templar society." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2094766/","name":"Assassin's Creed","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzE1OTczNTc1OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzgyMDI3MDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Callum Lynch explores the memories of his ancestor Aguilar de Nerha and gains the skills of a Master Assassin, before taking on the secret Templar society.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2094766/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Rinette"},"dateCreated":"2017-01-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very Enjoyable","reviewBody":"I have not played the Assassin's Creed games. However, this movie did not make me feel as though I needed to have played them in order to understand or enjoy the film.

The cinematography was great, and there were some magnificent aerial views of 15th century Spain along with modern day. Michael Fassbender and Marion Cotillard both gave excellent performances, managing to deliver the occasional corny, melodramatic dialogue with poise, and the supporting cast were equally great in their roles. Despite the occasional cheese, this film had some excellent dialogue that were thoughtful and poignant - unexpected in a fantasy action movie! Speaking of action - this was the best part of the movie. Gorgeous choreography, and I loved all the various weaponry and free running.

IMDb data; ttnr: 2094766, Title: Assassin's Creed, --- Description: Assassin's Creed: Directed by Justin Kurzel. With Michael Fassbender, Marion Cotillard, Jeremy Irons, Brendan Gleeson. Callum Lynch explores the memories of his ancestor Aguilar de Nerha and gains the skills of a Master Assassin, before taking on the secret Templar society." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2094766/","name":"Assassin's Creed","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzE1OTczNTc1OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzgyMDI3MDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Callum Lynch explores the memories of his ancestor Aguilar de Nerha and gains the skills of a Master Assassin, before taking on the secret Templar society.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2094766/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Rinette","dateCreated":"2017-01-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very Enjoyable","reviewBody":"I have not played the Assassin's Creed games. However, this movie did not make me feel as though I needed to have played them in order to understand or enjoy the film.

The cinematography was great, and there were some magnificent aerial views of 15th century Spain along with modern day. Michael Fassbender and Marion Cotillard both gave excellent performances, managing to deliver the occasional corny, melodramatic dialogue with poise, and the supporting cast were equally great in their roles. Despite the occasional cheese, this film had some excellent dialogue that were thoughtful and poignant - unexpected in a fantasy action movie! Speaking of action - this was the best part of the movie. Gorgeous choreography, and I loved all the various weaponry and free running.

This is by no means an award winning film, but overall it was incredibly enjoyable, and I don't think it quite deserves the negativity critics and fans of the games are giving it.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":193925,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2016-12-28","keywords":"based on video game,assassin,secret society,spain,spanish inquisition","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1056093721","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMyMzU3MzQ5MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTkzMTYzMDI@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMyMzU3MzQ5MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTkzMTYzMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"When Callum Lynch explores the memories of his ancestor Aguilar and gains the skills of a Master Assassin, he discovers he is a descendant of the secret Assassins society.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1055413/","name":"Michael Fassbender","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0182839/","name":"Marion Cotillard","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000460/","name":"Jeremy Irons"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0997291/","name":"Justin Kurzel"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0109033/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2078681/","name":"Michael Lesslie","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0177836/","name":"Adam Cooper","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0171651/","name":"Bill Collage"],"duration":"PT1H55M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Grimm
Grimm
Grimm
programme.desc:
Grimm: Created by Stephen Carpenter, David Greenwalt, Jim Kouf. With David Giuntoli, Russell Hornsby, Silas Weir Mitchell, Sasha Roiz. A homicide detective discovers he is a descendant of hunters who fight supernatural forces." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1830617/","name":"Grimm","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkyODg2MzQwMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTA2MjE1MDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A homicide detective discovers he is a descendant of hunters who fight supernatural forces.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1830617/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Johnny_West"},"dateCreated":"2021-05-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Entertaining & fun for the first couple of seasons","reviewBody":"Grimm was entertaining and fun for the first couple of seasons, when it focused on the simple monster-of-the-week stories. Unfortunately too many story-lines about the powerful royal family of vessen, the reapers, the vessen-grimm politics, and the vessen-killing military cult got introduced. The show got ridiculous and annoying.

Nick's wife became a central figure, a lot of insanely off-the-rails things happened to her, and her character was a big drag on the show, in my humble opinion. Claire Coffey was another character that became a drag because she was sleeping with every main character and having kids with them and Grimm became a soap opera about sleeping around, pregnancy clinics, parenting training, and family dynamics.

The last couple of seasons were really hard to watch. Grimm became Dr. Phil's Monster Families."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":114598,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2011-10-28","keywords":"male protagonist,occult detective,supernatural power,psychotronic series,crime drama","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1365912/","name":"David Giuntoli"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0395203/","name":"Russell Hornsby"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0593734/","name":"Silas Weir Mitchell"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0250594/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0147414/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046592/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0139461/","name":"Stephen Carpenter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0339264/","name":"David Greenwalt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0467942/","name":"Jim Kouf"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Grimm: Season 5","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3012080409","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWI1NTU1OWMtM2U3Yi00ZTY0LWI3YzEtZmMwOTRiN2M3ZmJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWI1NTU1OWMtM2U3Yi00ZTY0LWI3YzEtZmMwOTRiN2M3ZmJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Season 5 promo"}}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: The Incredible Hulk: Directed by Louis Leterrier. With Edward Norton, Liv Tyler, Tim Roth, William Hurt. Bruce Banner, a scientist on the run from the U.S. Government, must find a cure for the monster he turns into whenever he loses his temper." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0800080/","name":"The Incredible Hulk","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUyNzk3MjA1OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTE1Njg2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Bruce Banner, a scientist on the run from the U.S. Government, must find a cure for the monster he turns into whenever he loses his temper.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0800080/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"schristian-6"},"dateCreated":"2008-06-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Almost Incredible","reviewBody":"I attended a sneak preview of The Incredible Hulk last night. Incredible? No, but Very Good. And it washes the bad taste left in my mouth from Indiana Jones and the Big Letdown. The story is good, the acting is awesome. Ed Norton is the perfect person to play the tormented Bruce Banner. He is more believable in the roll than Eric Bana. Liv Tyler is very good as Betty Ross (formally played by the tasty Jennifer Connelly) William Hurt as General Ross is impressive and makes for a worthy adversary to Bruce Banner. If I had to come up with a negative, it would be Tim Roth. While I really like him, and he always plays great villains, I feel he's just miss cast here. He seems tiny next to General Ross. Instead of coming off like the English bad ass special op he's supposed to be, he comes off more like a jerk with Napoleon Syndrome. Someone more physically imposing like Vinnie Jones (Bullet tooth from Snatch), or Daniel Craig (the new Bond) would have been more convincing for the part. But I'm just picking here. The movie is a joy. Great action. No long boring, dragging development stuff that the first Hulk had in spades. There are some very nice cameos as well. Some were a surprise, some were not. I didn't see Nick Fury anywhere except in a brief headline in a montage. However I did not remain through the credits, so there might have been a scene at the end like Iron Man that I don't know about. I give it ***1/2 out of ****. I also predict it to make 80+million this weekend when it opens to the public and should "Hulk Smash" the competition. The movie received an ovation from the audience at the end which sums it up. A worthy movie made for the fans and everyone else."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":463386,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2008-06-18","keywords":"marvel cinematic universe,based on comic,bruce banner character,the incredible hulk character,reboot of series","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Incredible Hulk: Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1726152985","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYwMTQ4Mzk5NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDMyNjA3MQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYwMTQ4Mzk5NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDMyNjA3MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the second trailer for The Incredible Hulk, directed by Louis Leterrier."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001570/","name":"Edward Norton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000239/","name":"Liv Tyler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000619/","name":"Tim Roth"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0504642/","name":"Louis Leterrier"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0095134/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0051941/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0672015/","name":"Zak Penn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0498278/","name":"Stan Lee"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0456158/","name":"Jack Kirby"}],"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Lucy
Lucy
programme.desc: Lucy: Directed by Luc Besson. With Scarlett Johansson, Morgan Freeman, Choi Min-sik, Amr Waked. A woman, accidentally caught in a dark deal, turns the tables on her captors and transforms into a merciless warrior evolved beyond human logic." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2872732/","name":"Lucy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODcxMzY3ODY1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzg1NDY4MTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A woman, accidentally caught in a dark deal, turns the tables on her captors and transforms into a merciless warrior evolved beyond human logic.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2872732/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"swordsnare"},"dateCreated":"2020-03-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Luc Besson's 'Lucy'.","reviewBody":"I enjoyed this for the most-part. The momentum in combination with the 90 minute runtime, kept myself entertained for the entirety. It's far from perfect, but it's entertaining. Then again I didn't labour over the science to over complicate the overall enjoyment. The climax is probably the most contentious and unfavourable issue, but I appreciate the intent of Luc Besson's vision.\n\nNote: It's probably best to ignore the super low-scoring trolls, who create accounts to downvote and spread negativity. If you don't have some constructive criticism, don't say anything at all. Any 'Not helpful' downvotes on this review are probably by the aforementioned.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":472874,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2014-08-28","keywords":"drugs,brain capacity,fictional drug,tough girl,synthetic drug","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4114984217","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMzNDE5MzYxMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDQyOTQ5MTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMzNDE5MzYxMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDQyOTQ5MTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A woman, accidentally caught in a dark deal, turns the tables on her captors and transforms into a merciless warrior evolved beyond human logic."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0424060/","name":"Scarlett Johansson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000151/","name":"Morgan Freeman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0158856/","name":"Choi Min-sik"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000108/","name":"Luc Besson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048273/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0079764/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0240248/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000108/","name":"Luc Besson"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Realive
Realive
programme.desc:
Realive: Directed by Mateo Gil. With Oona Chaplin, Tom Hughes, Charlotte Le Bon, Melina Matthews. Marc will die of cancer and chooses cryogenic freeze and hopes to be thawed, when there's a solution to his condition. He's the first human brought back 68 years later. Can he adapt mentally and physically?" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4074928/","name":"Realive","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwNzA4OTE0Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODg3NTczMzI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Marc will die of cancer and chooses cryogenic freeze and hopes to be thawed, when there's a solution to his condition. He's the first human brought back 68 years later. Can he adapt mentally and physically?","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4074928/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"littleitaly-71510"},"dateCreated":"2017-10-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"More philosophy than sci-fi, true, but not lacking in the sci either","reviewBody":"So, a lot of people went into this movie expecting to be dazzled by hi- tech conceptualizations of the future, and were disappointed. That's understandable. The tech is a background at best, although every character does seem to blend seamlessly with it. It is a background that is tastefully crafted, realistically employed and never flickers. 

To add insult to injury, however, the 2 hour hypotech is stuffed with sentimentality and philosophy, rather than action and sex, as many sci- fi's are. For most people, action and sex are a far better filler than the heartfelt musings of a struggling soul, regardless of the context. 

For those of us not seeking to escape to the future, we were treated to a salient, cerebral wine-tasting, of sorts...and a sobering one at that. The film seems to offer up so many spiritual, cultural messages, from so many vantage points, that it's impossible to label one bottle and drink from it. For the single-minded it's a mess. For others, it's an awakening to new flavors of suffering, and a perversion of our taste buds. Some things, once sweet on our tongue, now stain with an aftertaste. Other drinks, like death, may now crisply tinkle in the glass and repel us a bit less. 

All I'm saying is that this film is more art than entertainment. Some people drink wine to get drunk and have sex. Others sip it carefully to explore its variety. Realive is certainly a film for the sipping class.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5172,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2017-01-13","keywords":"nurse,cryonics,live birth,timeframe 2080s,love","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1411299609","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODQ2MTM3NDQyMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTU1NjczMzI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODQ2MTM3NDQyMl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTU1NjczMzI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Marc (Tom Hughes) is diagnosed with a disease and is given one year left to live. Unable to accept his own end, he decides to freeze his body. Sixty years later, in the year 2084, he becomes the first man to be revived in history. It is then he discovers that the love of his life, Naomi (Oona Chaplin), has accompanied him this entire time in a way that he'd never expected."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2772105/","name":"Oona Chaplin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3433735/","name":"Tom Hughes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3114649/","name":"Charlotte Le Bon"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0317834/","name":"Mateo Gil"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0134199/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0556435/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0071913/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0317834/","name":"Mateo Gil"}],"duration":"PT1H52M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Bibliotekarz 2: Tajemnice kopalni króla Salomona
programme.desc: Flynn Carsen, pracownik Biblioteki Metropolitalnej, dostaje starożytny zwój. Gdy odkrywa, że jest to mapa prowadząca do kopalni króla Salomona, postanawia ją odnaleźć. Towarzyszy mu Emily Davenport. Dla miłośników przygód Indiany Jonesa i wcielającego się w Carsena Noaha Wyle'a, który zagrał rolę swojego życia w serialu "Ostry dyżur".

programme.title: The Librarian: The Curse of the Judas Chalice
Bibliotekarz III: Klątwa kielicha Judasza
The Librarian: Curse of the Judas Chalice
programme.desc:
The Librarian: The Curse of the Judas Chalice: Directed by Jonathan Frakes. With Noah Wyle, Bruce Davison, Stana Katic, Bob Newhart. Losing his girlfriend because he was at an auction dramatically getting the magical philosopher's stone instead of a date, he needs a vacation - New Orleans but finds himself busy saving Earth from the curse of the Judas chalice/vampires." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1146438/","name":"The Librarian: The Curse of the Judas Chalice","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI3MDM2MzEyOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzQxNjMzMg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Losing his girlfriend because he was at an auction dramatically getting the magical philosopher's stone instead of a date, he needs a vacation - New Orleans but finds himself busy saving Earth from the curse of the Judas chalice/vamp","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1146438/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"boblipton"},"dateCreated":"2008-12-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great Pulp","reviewBody":"In bygone days people used to read cheap magazines printed on cheap pulp paper. These were full of stories which, if not particularly literary, were full of action, color and plot. Later these moved to the movie serials and B movies, whence they were lifted, in the 1970s and 1980s, as the inspiration for movies like RAIDERS OF THE LOST ARK, ROMANCING THE STONE and STAR WARS. This TV movie, third in the series, is in that vein.

CURSE OF THE OF JUDAS CHALICE is no ground-breaking movie, but it is enormous fun, with a script full of hip, self-aware humor -- Noah Wyle explains the key plot points as he goes along, and is twitted for always speaking in complete paragraphs -- action and a sexy vampiress. There is nothing in this that is original -- I could do a little digging and produce a list of where the key plot points and shots were lifted from -- but it is done with such good humor, that the viewer will have few, if any complaints about the result. 

My sole complaint is that Bob Newhart is not on screen long enough with his deadpan delivery. You can't do much better for a dull afternoon's time-waster.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12914,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2008-12-07","keywords":"vampire,dracula,judas chalice,supernatural artefact,vampire suicide","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Librarian: The Curse of the Judas Chalice","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3761111833","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk1NTk3NjgwMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTg0NDQzMg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk1NTk3NjgwMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTg0NDQzMg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The trailer for the DVD release of The Librarian: The Curse of the Judas Chalice"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001864/","name":"Noah Wyle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001117/","name":"Bruce Davison"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1065664/","name":"Stana Katic"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000408/","name":"Jonathan Frakes"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003899/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0773605/","name":"Marco Schnabel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0864435/","name":"David N. programme.title: Stardust
Gwiezdny pył
Stardust
programme.desc: Stardust: Directed by Matthew Vaughn. With Ian McKellen, Bimbo Hart, Alastair MacIntosh, David Kelly. In a countryside town bordering on a magical land, a young man makes a promise to his beloved that he'll retrieve a fallen star by venturing into the magical realm." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0486655/","name":"Stardust","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjkyMTE1OTYwNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDIxODYzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In a countryside town bordering on a magical land, a young man makes a promise to his beloved that he'll retrieve a fallen star by venturing into the magical realm.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0486655/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dave_wright87"},"dateCreated":"2007-11-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"The most fantastical adventure of the year!","reviewBody":"I went into this film with modest hopes, the director had pedigree, I had seen Charlie Cox in Casanova and was impressed, and literally EVERYONE had been raving about it. As the story started to unfold I was introduced to Victorian England on one side of a mysterious Wall, and on the other a magical land, Stormhold. The actual plot weaves together many strands and I don't want to ruin the surprises for anyone, but at the barest it is the simple tale of a young man (Charlie Cox) in love with the village beauty (Sienna Miller). To win her love he tells her he will fetch back a fallen star from the other side of the Wall. Howver when he arrives at the star he finds not a lump of astral metal as he expected but a beautiful woman (Claire Danes). As the two journey back to the wall they find themselves in the adventure of a lifetime. The visuals are brilliant, England looks stunning, in a similar fashion to New Zealand in LOTR, and it s full of wonderful little flourishes, such as the way that the star shines when she is happy, a very simple effect, but one that looks radiant. As well as this the acting good, especially from the leads and Robert DeNiro, whose turn as the captain of an airship is incredibly memorable. This film is THE perfect date movie, it is romantic without being a "chick flick", funny and full of wonderful action pieces that will satisfy any action film fan. All in all it is a truly magical experience from beginning to end, and I now Im raving about it to EVERYONE!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":265282,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Family","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2007-10-24","keywords":"witch,magic,transformation,shooting star,one word title","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Stardust","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4018471193","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjM0NDhmOGMtNjk3MS00ZjFkLThhOGQtZmZiYmY5OWI2MDM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjM0NDhmOGMtNjk3MS00ZjFkLThhOGQtZmZiYmY5OWI2MDM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Paramount"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1214435/","name":"Charlie Cox"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000132/","name":"Claire Danes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1092227/","name":"Sienna Miller"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0891216/","name":"Matthew Vaughn"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0165404/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0325567/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0963359/","name":"Jane Goldman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0891216/","name":"Matthew Vaughn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0301274/","name":"Neil Gaiman"}],"duration":"PT2H7M"}</script><metacontent="
